item.title: Ephesians 3:1-7
item.itunes:subtitle: The Flood of Grace
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: We see in our passage today the word “dispensation, (Greek: oikonomia ), it is where we get our word “Economy” .  A lot of people struggle with this word, and theologians come up with books upon books to explain it, but it simply means a “set order of how things work.” God saying I’m setting the order of how things are going to work and nothing can change it.  Satan, evilness, terrorism, prosperity, will not change my plan, or how I run my plan, and it will all happen in the “fullness of time, on my timetable (remember 1:10).  Paul will show in these verses that the fullness of time has come, and the church is now in the period “of the grace of God.”

item.title: Ephesians 2:11-22
item.itunes:subtitle: God Wants You
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary:
Summary: You are the dwelling place of God!  The Holy God, dwells in you, and if you are wondering what all the means listen on as we study what that means.  As we have said in a prior study, there are only 3 things that matter in real estate, and every real estate agent confirms….. location, location, location.  When looking for a place to live, dwell, the number one thing is always location…… this is where I want to live. Whether it is one reason or a thousand reasons, we come to the place of….. this is where I want to live.  God, the creator of the universe, He who sits upon the throne, wants to live with you and in you.


How does just that thought make you feel today?  How long has it been since you “remembered that”?  When we find the perfect house, we say I want this house, I am willing to buy this house, because I really want this house.  God wants you.  Maybe you don’t feel wanted, maybe you feel second in everyone’s life, maybe it isn’t even a felling but a demonstrated fact, that you are second, or a demonstrated fact that you are unwanted.  BUT GOD….. says to you today in this passage, I want you!

item.title: Ephesians 2:8-10
item.itunes:subtitle: You are God’s Poem
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Surely, we have reached the summit of the New Testament here in this passage.  Our passage today summarizes the greatest gift (everlasting salvation), from the greatest lover (God’s own heart), and God’s greatest thoughts of you (His masterpiece).  When, if we, can fully comprehend what is declared to us in these verses, we will live in power, we will live in peace, we will be secure in our salvation, and secure in our identity (not just in the life to come, but the life here now), we will walk a walk that nothing in this world can move or diminish.  Oh, what a passage that is before us today.

item.title: Ephesians 2:1-7
item.itunes:subtitle: Our Past, Present, and Future (Amazing)
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary:
Summary: From dead in sin to seated with Christ in heavenly places—what a transformation! This Sunday we explored Ephesians 2:1-7 and discovered the breathtaking reality of our past, present, and future in Christ.


We were once dead in trespasses and sins, walking according to the world's standards. But God—those two powerful words change everything! Rich in mercy and great in love, He made us alive together with Christ. Not only alive, but raised up and seated with Him in heavenly places. You are God's trophy of grace, His inheritance, loved before the foundation of the world.


Here's the beautiful truth: His kindness leads us to repentance, not our dwelling on failures. God is patting the seat next to Him, saying "Come sit here with Me." For all eternity, He wants to show you the exceeding riches of His grace. That's not just your future—that's your reality today.


Change the way you think. Live like you're called. You've been made alive!

item.title: Ephesians 1:15-23
item.itunes:subtitle: Using God’s Promises in Our Daily Walk
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: The Book of Ephesians is about all the spiritual riches available to the believer. Ephesians 1:3 the theme of the whole book says, Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ: For the first fourteen verses the Apostle Paul talks about how we are "born spiritually rich" when we trusted Christ.  But he says that being born spiritually rich is not enough, for we must grow in our understanding of our riches if we are ever going to use them to the glory of God.  God desired that the Christians in Ephesus understood what great spiritual wealth they had in Christ.   After talking about Knowledge is Power through the first 14 verses, Paul goes and starts to pray for them that they would seize this Knowledge and have the Power to use in their daily walk.  Two thousand years later, God desires the same for us today.

item.title: The Seal
item.itunes:subtitle: Ephesians 1:11-14
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: God Seals Us when we believe. Why does this passage of scripture matter to you today?  Well quite simply, if a person continually struggles with what is their purpose and worth in life, and if they continually struggle with their eternal security, they will never be able to move on and live in the victorious Christian life that God purposes for them, and promises for them to have for the taking.  And notice, I say for the taking, because although God purposes it and secures it for the Believer, the believer still must take it by their own freewill choosing.

item.title: Ephesians 1:7-10
item.itunes:subtitle: Redemption Puts the Broken Pieces Back Together
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary:
Summary: Life has a way of leaving us in pieces. Relationships fracture. Dreams shatter. Sin separates. From the moment humanity fell in the Garden of Eden, the story of our existence has been one of things falling apart—man separated from God, brother against brother, nation against nation. Yet woven throughout Scripture is a counter-narrative, a divine promise that what has been broken will be made whole again.


This is the heart of redemption.

item.title: Prophecy Update_December 2025
item.itunes:subtitle: What In the World is Going On?
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: A special study where we open up the newspaper and the Bible, and see prophecy coming together before our very eyes. Prophecy isn't just about future predictions; it's about knowing God better, living intentionally now, and being prepared for Christ's return, making it a practical and essential part of Christian faith.

item.title: The Chosen
item.itunes:subtitle: Ephesians 1:3-4
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: This week's sermon from Ephesians 1:3-4 explores the incredible truth that we have been chosen by God and blessed with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in Christ. We discover that our identity as saints is not something we earn through our efforts, but rather a position we occupy because of God's perfect love. The sermon challenges us to move from earthly thinking to heavenly thinking - to stop living like spiritual paupers when we have unlimited riches available to us in Christ. Just as God moved the fence to bring us into His presence, He has secured our position once and for all, declaring us holy and without blame before Him in love.

item.itunes:subtitle: Resting in God's Love
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: We can rest in God’s Love…. Because God is resting in His Love for us! Our passage today brings that straight from the heart of God.

item.title: Genesis 50
item.itunes:subtitle: From Paradise to Prison: The Story That Ends in a Coffin but Promises So Much More
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: The book of Genesis opens with the magnificent words, "Let there be light." It closes with a coffin in Egypt. From the glory of God's creation to the darkness of death—this is the trajectory of humanity's story after the fall. Yet within this descent lies an incredible thread of hope, woven through generations of imperfect people who clung to an unshakeable promise from God!

item.title: Genesis 49
item.itunes:subtitle: The Prophetic Blessings: Jacob's Final Words to His Sons
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary:
Summary: There's something profoundly moving about a father's final words to his children. When Jacob gathered his twelve sons around his deathbed in Egypt, he didn't simply say goodbye. He spoke prophetically over each one, revealing their character, their destiny, and the future of the nation that would spring from their lineage.


This moment, recorded in Genesis 49, is far more than an ancient family gathering. It's a window into God's sovereign plan—a plan that stretches from paradise lost to paradise restored, from the garden of Eden to the coming Messiah.

item.title: Genesis 48
item.itunes:subtitle: The Blessings That Flow When We Choose to Bless Others
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: There's something profoundly beautiful about visiting someone who is sick or struggling. You arrive thinking you're the one bringing comfort, only to discover that you're the one who leaves transformed. This divine paradox appears throughout Scripture, and nowhere is it more evident than in the story of Jacob's final days in Genesis 48.

item.title: Genesis 47
item.itunes:subtitle: Giving the Blessings of the Lord to Others
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Jacob's story is one of transformation. The deceiver became Israel, the prince with God. The schemer became the blesser. His final years in Egypt were marked by faith, maturity, and anticipation of God's promises. Your best chapter is yet to come. God is still working, still refining, still conforming you to the image of His Son. Be confident of this: He who began a good work in you will complete it (Philippians 1:6). So go into the world as Jacob went into Pharaoh's court. Speak blessing over the powerful and the powerless alike. Place God's name upon everyone you meet. And watch as He transforms both them and you in the process. You are a stranger and pilgrim here—but you carry the authority of heaven. Use it to bless.

item.title: Genesis 46
item.itunes:subtitle: Fear Not: God's Confirmation for the Journey Ahead
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Life often brings us to crossroads where the path forward seems uncertain. We stand at the border between what we know and what lies ahead, torn between the pull of our hearts and the wisdom of waiting. In these moments, we need more than good intentions—we need divine direction. Jacob (Israel) will be given Divine direction in our passage today as he takes the whole family down to Egypt; and along the way the Lord will give us insights on how to seek His Divine direction when we are making our life decisions.

item.title: Genesis 45
item.itunes:subtitle: Forgiveness
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In our passage Joseph reveals himself to his brothers who had sold him into slavery some 22-year prior. They are shocked, and of course fearful for their sin has found them out, and they stand before Joseph who has the power to punish them to death if he so choses. But Joseph will say to them, don't be grieved. Don't be troubled. In essence he is saying, I forgive you, I love you, I don't hold anything against you; so be free in these words that I give you so that we can have a relationship, be a family again, and be one. In this study we will see what a man/woman, who walks with God, does. This is who a man/woman... who sees themselves in light of who God is….. and what and how they respond…… they respond like God.

item.title: Genesis 44
item.itunes:subtitle: Mercy
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Our passage culminates with the brothers of Joseph have come to the end of their end, and all they have left is to cry out for mercy. Mercy…. ever want it? When you do want it, it will cry from the depth of your heart to receive it, nothing else in life will seem to matter at that moment. Mercy….. ever receive it? When you do receive it, it will be as a kiss of God, for mercy is the heart of God. Mercy…. ever give it? When you do, it will be the very heart of God to the brokenhearted.

item.title: Genesis 43
item.itunes:subtitle: The Forging of a Nation
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: The Lord continues to break and remake these 10 brothers into the men of God they need to be, as they will be the foundation of the great Nation Israel. God is forging them, and fashioning them, so He may do something great with them and in them. God does the same today, for every one of us, and it is a high calling, but worth it all…… so that God may be glorified! Join us as we study a passage that is not just about the sons of Jacob, but each and every one of us.

item.title: Genesis 42
item.itunes:subtitle: The Famine in the Land
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: For the people, it has been 7 years of plenty, hey let the good times roll, never knowing a famine was coming.  How long into the famine before they realized this is serious.  And little did they know, but it was 20 years prior that God had been preparing for this famine, and raising up Joseph to lead them through it.  I wonder what God is doing today in my life, in your life, that is preparing for something 20 years down the road.  What a chapter of comfort and confidence in our God whose hand is always upon us, working all things together for good!

item.title: Genesis 41
item.itunes:subtitle: Then It Came to Pass
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: After 13 years of slavery and imprisonment, Joseph will not only be free, but be made second in command of all or Egypt. Joseph was seventeen years old when he was lifted from the pit and taken to Egypt. Now he’s thirty and he’s reached the palace. In between were thirteen long, troubling years. There were many paths God could’ve used to get Joseph from the pit to the palace, but destination was not the point. By doing it His way, God not only made a way, He made a man. Join us as we are encouraged and strengthened as God does the same in our lives.

item.title: Genesis 40
item.itunes:subtitle: The Extreme Test
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Joseph is in imprisoned, even though he did what was right. Choosing to do what is right doesn’t mean that everything will initially turn out wonderful.  We choose a do what is right because God is holy, and these are the standard that He sets for the people that He sets apart.  We have been bought with a price; living with that mindset, sets us apart from the world, and sets us above the world into the eternal perspective.  Choose to do what is right and ultimately everything turns out for His glory, because you’ve honored the Lord and any time the Lord is honored in and through you, you know He is pleased.

item.title: Genesis 39
item.itunes:subtitle: And Whatever You Do, Do It for the Glory of God
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: A truly remarkable chapter in the Bible, as we see this young man Joseph give glory to God through his life by being a living sacrifice and witness as he withstands temptations and trials. Join us as we glean strength and lessons for our trials and temptations in life.

item.title: Genesis 38
item.itunes:subtitle: The Story of Judah & Tamar (and God’s Amazing Grace)
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Another strange, but true story that God reveals in the Scriptures for us the story of Judah and Tamar. As strange and as sordid as this story is, God reveals a tapestry of love and forgiveness that weaves all the way to the birth of Jesus; and the story reveals that try as Satan will to destroy the plans of God, his efforts are futile, and that would mean his efforts against you as well. You don’t want to miss this study.

item.title: Genesis 37
item.itunes:subtitle: The Life of Joseph: A Reflection of Christ and a Call to Faith
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: The story of Joseph in the book of Genesis is a powerful narrative that encompasses nearly 25% of this foundational text. While only one chapter is devoted to the creation of the universe, God chose to dedicate a significant portion to Joseph's life. This emphasis begs the question: Why? The answer lies in the profound truth that God desires us to know the Creator more than the creation itself. Through Joseph's life, we see a vivid picture of Jesus Christ, offering us deep spiritual insights and a call to unwavering faith.

item.title: Genesis 36
item.itunes:subtitle: The Legacy of the Life of the Flesh (Nothing)
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: God puts these words before us, this genealogy of Esau, so we can see that the works of the flesh all end in nothing.  In the end the flesh ends up with nothing, the flesh fades and withers.  Esau's lineage had the kingdom, the power, and the glory.  The three things man in his flesh want, yet in the end, ends with nothing.

item.title: Genesis 34-35
item.itunes:subtitle: Be a Separate People
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: We will be looking at Jacob stopping short of God's will of where he should be, and he will reap the consequences and his whole family as well in one of the most disastrous stories of the Bible with the violation of his daughter, Dinah. But Jacob will use that horrible circumstance to get himself up and get going to where God had called him to go and be, and get things right between him, his family, and the Lord. A great passage for all of us, especially when we think God’s grace has an expiration date on it.

item.title: Genesis 32-33
item.itunes:subtitle: A Broken Man
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In Genesis 32, Jacob faces a moment of deep fear and crisis as he prepares to meet his brother Esau, whom he had wronged years earlier. Overwhelmed by anxiety, Jacob prays humbly, acknowledging his unworthiness and pleading for God’s deliverance. That night, alone and desperate, Jacob wrestles with a mysterious man—God Himself in human form. In this struggle, Jacob is physically broken, his hip put out of joint, yet he clings in faith, refusing to let go without a blessing. God renames him Israel (which means “Governed by God”), marking the transformation of Jacob from a self-reliant schemer to a man dependent on God’s grace.

item.title: Genesis 30-31
item.itunes:subtitle: Jacob Moves On
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: It is time, as God has appointed the time for Jacob to move on from his Uncle Laban, and back to the Promised Land, and start God’s work on what will be the Land, and the Messiah to come and provide Himself the sacrifice for sin. Even with a great calling upon his life it appears that Jacob is getting comfortable in his good life, so God has to stir things up to get him moving in the right direction. Maybe that is where you are at, and God is stirring your life through some hard or uncomfortable circumstances; Good word for all of us in this passage. Join Us!

item.title: Genesis 29
item.itunes:subtitle: Jacob Went On His Journey
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Subject: The passage begins by saying that “So Jacob went on his journey”. Jacob’s journey, is so much like our journey in this world with high and lows, hopes and dreams, joys and sorrows. Jacob is going to find some of all these in this chapter; but most importantly, God is going to show him himself, so God can do something about the things that need changed in him. God will do the same for all of us. Join Us.

item.title: Genesis 28
item.itunes:subtitle: Do We Truly Understand Grace
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In our passage today, we read of one of e greatest accounts of grace and Jacob is on the run from his brother Esau for deceiving him and his father Issac regarding the family blessing; yet God shows up and pours grace out upon him.  We don’t understand grace and that’s the point, for if we could, it wouldn’t be grace. We can only stand on the promise of grace, and receive it, though never fully understanding it. Maybe you need some grace, or need to give some grace, join us God pours out His grace.

item.title: Genesis 27
item.itunes:subtitle: Which One Are You?
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary:
Summary: In our study we will see Jacob and Rebekah deceive Isaac to pass the spiritual blessing unto Jacon rather than Esau. Each of us can be one of these four, so the question before the study, which one are you, and what can you do about it? Are You:

·       Isaac – Who spiritually went from on-fire, to slow-fade, to a vapor?

·       Esau – Who chose the things of the world and flesh, over the things of the Spirit?

·       Jacob – Who recognized the things of the Spirit, but tried to obtain through the flesh?

·       Rebekah – Who went from person of prayer, to I will do it my way?

item.title: Genesis 26
item.itunes:subtitle: When Life’s Famines Come, Where Do You Go?
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Famines in our spiritual lives come from time to time. The question for us is, “where do You go, what do You do when they come?” In our passage today we will see Isaac enter a famine, and God will give us many great spiritual lessons from his life to apply to our lives in our time of need. Join Us!

item.title: Genesis 25
item.itunes:subtitle: The Days of a Full Life
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In our passage today, we say goodbye to a dear friend (Abraham). We get to know Isaac his son in a deeper way, and are introduced to Jacob, who will become the Father of Israel. We will also come to know Issac’s brother Ishmael in a deeper way and introduced to Jacob’s brother Esau. All these men will live life, but not all will live “full satisfying” lives. Join us as we study….. “how to live and have a full and satisfying life”.

item.title: Genesis 24
item.itunes:subtitle: Here Comes the Bride
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: This chapter is the longest chapter in the Book of Genesis, and that is not surprising considering the whole chapter is a picture of God’s Bride…… you! Join us as the Lord says to us…… to take a good, long, lingering look at how I feel about you.

item.title: Genesis 23
item.itunes:subtitle: The Death of Sarah (Abraham Loses His Princess)
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In our chapter today, we will read of the death of Sarah (Abraham’s wife), whose name means “princess”. As Abraham weeps, we will see the heart of God who says He catches and keeps all our tears in a bottle. And through all the tears, the passage gives a beautiful picture, and promise, of the resurrection.

item.itunes:subtitle: The Greatest Three Words Ever Spoken
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary:
Summary: 2,000 years ago, the greatest three words in the history of mankind were spoken. What do they

mean to you, and how do you apply them to your life today. Join us for a special message from the heart of

God.

item.title: Genesis 22
item.itunes:subtitle: After These Things
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: My hope is always hopeful because my God always has an ….”after these things” for me. Always a tomorrow, always a day after, whether after a failure or fault, a mountain high or a valley low, there is always an… “after these things” because there is a cross, a resurrection, by the God who provided all these things, including Himself upon the cross for me. And He is always on the move in my life and your life!
item.description: Summary: My hope is always hopeful because my God always has an ….”after these things” for me. Always a tomorrow, always a day after, whether after a failure or fault, a mountain high or a valley low, there is always an… “after these things” because there is a cross, a resurrection, by the God who provided all these things, including Himself upon the cross for me. And He is always on the move in my life and your life!

And He is always on the move in my life and your life!

item.title: Genesis 21
item.itunes:subtitle: All the Promises of God are Yes and Amen!
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: It is 25-years later, but here is the promise given to Abraham and Sarah fulfilled with the birth of Issac. The child of promise is Issac, and his name means laughter. Surely people laughed at the impossibility of having a child at such an age; but now we will read they laugh with them, in the amazement of what only God can do. He is the same God today…. And people may be laughing at what you say God is going to do in your life, but someday they will be laughing with you in amazement saying ….. He did it!

item.title: Genesis 20
item.itunes:subtitle: Written for Our Example
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In our study Abraham will repeat the same failing of faith that he did almost 25 years prior. We can poke at the Father-of-Faith and ask how could you? But the Lord reminds us that these Old Testament stories were written as examples for us. So here we find several examples “for us”, and in each of them we will explore if we too are repeating the same failings time and time again….. and maybe not even realize that we are.

item.title: Genesis 19
item.itunes:subtitle: God Knew Where to Find Lot
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Although the focus of the chapter is on Sodom and Gomorrah, the chapter in whole tells a broader story that goes beyond just what the chapter is known for. It speaks of the warning to believers that even the righteous can compromise. But God knew where to find Lot, and us, and He comes, and He speaks to us (any and all who are willing to hear). Join us as we study this story that is both historical, and personally applicable.

item.title: Genesis 18
item.itunes:subtitle: Dining, and Delighting, and Declaring
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In our chapter today, the Lord will “dine” with Abraham because He's a God of intimacy and fellowship with His people. God will “delight” Sarah as He tells her of the promise of the child she will have even when she's having a hard time believing.  And thirdly, the Lord “declares” to Abraham what's on His heart because God tells those that care. The question for all of us today, “what can God tell us”?

item.title: Genesis 17
item.itunes:subtitle: He is God Almighty
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: When Abram was 99 God appeared to him telling him I am “God Almighty” (Heb. El Shaddai). Shaddai comes from an old word meaning “mountain” and refers to His mighty power that is high and unshakable. And, if Abram wanted to know God’s power, he had to walk, that is live, close to the Lord. So too the passage before us speaks the same unto us. How can we do it? Join us for Genesis 17 to for the “how to”.

item.title: Genesis 16
item.itunes:subtitle: The God Who Sees Me
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Time has a way of erasing the promises of God that He has given us but have yet to come to pass. And Abraham and Sarah have forgotten His promise, so they try to put human logic into the middle of faith, and it just never works out, other than a mess in the flesh. But the story in this chapter comes one of the greatest stories in the Bible as we see that God sees Hagar who is mistreated and cast off and in a place of hurting, and the Lord comes to her an Egyptian bondwoman and reveals Himself in a special way; and so the Lord seeks all the outcast and hurting today for He is the same yesterday today and forever.

item.title: Genesis 15
item.itunes:subtitle: The Word of the LORD Came
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Abram is fearful, a great high moment comes with a new reality that there are things outside his control. In the midst of his fear a beautiful phase appears for the first time in the Bible, “The word of the LORD came to Abram”, and it becomes the foundation not just for his fear, but his faith as well. Whether it is fear or faith, the Lord has a “Word” for you in all your questions. Join us for a “Word” from the very heart of God.

item.title: Genesis 14
item.itunes:subtitle: The King of Righteousness
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: What a golden nugget of a chapter as we will read that after Abram rescues his nephew Lot who was taking captive; that on his return Abram will meet the King of Salem (whose name is Melchizedek), who very well could have been the appearance of Jesus in the Old Testament. Absolutely an amazing passage as it will speak volumes of not just tying the Old Testament to the New Testament (as we read of Melchizedek again in the Book of Hebrews), but an amazing account about how God meets with each and every one of us.

item.title: Genesis 13
item.itunes:subtitle: The Place of the Altar
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Even after Abram’s failing of faith down in Egypt, God meets him at the altar he had built in the Promised Land before the failing. God is so gracious, kind, and longsuffering with us; and is always ready to meet us to fellowship and commune together with Him in love. Maybe you need to come back to the altar of His promises today for a fresh reunion and restoration. Join us as we see the heart of God to us even after a failing of faith.

item.title: Genesis 12
item.itunes:subtitle: Nothing
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: The title of this study is “nothing”, and when asked what we studied, we will say “nothing”. And the “nothing” that we will study and apply to our lives personally is that Abraham did “nothing” to be chosen and called by God. There was “nothing” in or about Abraham that made him chosen; it was all God’s grace to call him. Therefore, as we study the life of Abraham in the chapters to come, and we see time of great faith, along with times of great failings, we can remember that “nothing” can keep us from the love of God, because “nothing” was the reason God called us to Himself except His great love.

item.title: Genesis 11
item.itunes:subtitle: One Language - One Speech
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In our passage at the Tower of Babel, we see a whole world with one language and one speech, and they totally misspend it on self and self-serving purposes, all of which crumbles and goes off into confusion. For us as believers in Christ, we have a chapter filled with great application to abundant life, with clear focus and direction. Join us!

item.title: Genesis 10
item.itunes:subtitle: The Table of Nations
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Although often skipped over because this chapter seems like a long list of names, this chapter is foundational and critical to understanding prophecies in the Bible, and the root of all false religions, while at the same time it gives every individual follower of Christ the challenge of how they want to be known as disciples of Christ.

item.title: Genesis 9
item.itunes:subtitle: The Covenant with a Sign
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: God not only makes a covenant with mankind with words (never to flood the earth again with water), but He gives the rainbow to be the sign to remind us of His covenant. He does the same with the “New Covenant”, that our sins will be forgiven and washed away never to be remembered by Him, and He gives us a sign to remember His promised covenant, and that is the fellowship of Communion with Him and each other. Join us as we walk through this great passage, verse-by-verse.

item.title: Genesis 8
item.itunes:subtitle: And God Remembered Noah
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: God of course never forgot Noah and family, nor will He forget you in the midst of your storm or trial. The word actually means, to “think upon”, and God was continually thinking upon Noah and family, just as He thinks upon you and your family. And this chapter 8, takes us into amazing depths of God’s thoughts for us, and the chapter closes with God “sharing His heart” with Noah; amazingly, God shares His heart with us as well. Join us as we see all these things and how they apply to us today.

item.title: Genesis 7
item.itunes:subtitle: Come Into the Ark
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: For the Lord to tell Noah to “Come into the Ark”, could only mean that the Lord was in the Ark. In our passage we will look into all that meant to Noah and family in the midst of flood; and what it means to each of us in the trials of life we go through.
item.description: Summary: For the Lord to tell Noah to “Come into the Ark”, could only mean that the Lord was in the Ark. In our passage we will look into all that meant to Noah and family in the midst of flood; and what it means to each of us in the trials of life we go through.

item.title: Genesis 6
item.itunes:subtitle: Noah Found Grace in the Eyes of God
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Even in the midst of the flood to come, God’s grace abounds and extends and reaches to any and all who will receive it. God’s heart grieves because of the flood to come, yet His grieved heart comes with compassion as He provides a way out for any willing to get on the Ark.

item.title: Genesis 5
item.itunes:subtitle: The Family Album
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Here we have the family album, that all of us are descendants of and from, and we will be blessed tremendously as we read not of boring genealogy, but God’s amazing grace, all the way from Adam to you and me.
item.description: Summary: Here we have the family album, that all of us are descendants of and from, and we will be blessed tremendously as we read not of boring genealogy, but God’s amazing grace, all the way from Adam to you and me.

item.title: Genesis 4
item.itunes:subtitle: Your Offering
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In our passage today, we study the story of Cain and Abel; and the whole matter was based on and began with Cain’s wrong attitude and understanding of what God requires of a sacrifice/offering. This passage is vital to our understanding of sacrifices and offerings made unto the Lord, because in Romans 12:1-2, we are called to be “Living Sacrifices/Offerings”. Genesis 4 will lay the foundation for us so that we might be a pleasing sacrifice/offering unto the Lord.

item.title: Genesis 3
item.itunes:subtitle: The Encounter in the Garden
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Nothing will make sense in this whole world and in our whole lives personally, apart from understanding chapters 1, 2 and 3 Genesis. But when we look and understand chapters 1, 2 and 3 of Genesis, then everything in life will make sense even in so much senselessness that we see in the world today.

item.title: Genesis 2
item.itunes:subtitle: Resting in the Lord
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: The Lord’s rests in chapter 2, and speaks a message to us that we too can rest, in all things as we rest in Him; whether that be work, ministry, marriage, or singleness…. We can rest in Him.
item.description: Summary: The Lord’s rests in chapter 2, and speaks a message to us that we too can rest, in all things as we rest in Him; whether that be work, ministry, marriage, or singleness…. We can rest in Him.

item.title: Genesis 1
item.itunes:subtitle: In the Beginning God.....Created!
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: We start a new Book, and it is the book of beginnings. The word for “created” in the original Hebrew language is “bara”, and it means “to create out of nothing”. The first verse is vital in so many ways as the foundation of the whole Word of God (Bible); but equally as well this word “bara” (out of nothing) as God declares to us, He is the “Bara God” and take what seems to be nothing there in our lives personally, and create something beautiful and wonderful out of it.

item.title: Revelation 22:10-21
item.itunes:subtitle: The Testimony of Jesus Christ
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Today we finish the Book of Revelation, and what a finish it is. But the whole Book leads to the main point for every person…… how will you finish? Will stand before Him in glory, or be separated from Him for all eternity in hell? God invites you to Himself, He says….Come!

item.title: Revelation 22:1-9
item.itunes:subtitle: The River, the Tree, and the Light
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: We are going to heaven, together! Join us as we come in to our final studies in the final chapter of the Book of Revelation. The Water of Life, the Tree of Life, His Name written on our foreheads; only Heaven could declare such things.
item.description: Summary: We are going to heaven, together! Join us as we come in to our final studies in the final chapter of the Book of Revelation. The Water of Life, the Tree of Life, His Name written on our foreheads; only Heaven could declare such things.

item.title: Revelation 21:9-27
item.itunes:subtitle: The New Jerusalem
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: As we finish chapter 21, and look at the New Jerusalem coming down, we will see that it is not the city, that makes it amazing, but it’s inhabitants….. all of us who call Him Lord, and He has made His Bride.
item.description: Summary: As we finish chapter 21, and look at the New Jerusalem coming down, we will see that it is not the city, that makes it amazing, but it’s inhabitants….. all of us who call Him Lord, and He has made His Bride.

item.title: Revelation 21:1-8
item.itunes:subtitle: The New Heaven and the New Earth
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: A new heaven, and a new earth, God will dwell among His people, and wipe away every tear, no more death, no more sorrow, no more pain! And in verse 5, God tells John to make sure you write these things down, because the Lord wants His people to hear it, and not forget what is to come (all the more when living in hard times today). Join us, for something God wants to make sure we hear.

item.title: Revelation 20:7-15
item.itunes:subtitle: Judgement Day
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Our passage today is the “Day of Judgment”, also called the “Great White Throne Judgment”; At that Throne, on that Day, we read that books will be open that recorded our “works”, and that will determine the judgement of God upon each person. When that Day comes, and those books are opened, will you pass, The Good Person Test? Join us to be sure that you are sure.

item.title: Revelation 20:4-6
item.itunes:subtitle: The Millennial Kingdom
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: The Millennial Kingdom, as spoken of in Revelation 20, is a 1,000 year period that begins right after the Tribulation Period. We will live here on earth with Jesus for 1,000 years. Wow, a thousand years, that is a long time. What will we be doing, what will the earth be like, who else will be here? We will look into these questions and more, and most importantly the question, how should this affect my life today as a follower of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Revelation 20:1-3
item.itunes:subtitle: Satan is Bound
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Chapter 20 begins a new section of the Book of Revelation as the 7-year Tribulation Period has ended, and now Jesus will establish His Kingdom on earth. The first thing He does is bind the Devil and cast him into the bottomless pit (the Abousso).  We will look at the who, the what, the when, the where, the why….and most importantly, the “how – does this affect my spiritual walk”.

item.title: Revelation 19:17-21
item.itunes:subtitle: The Battle of Armageddon
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Hollywood has made scores of movies, making millions of dollars, regarding “Armageddon”; but in our study today we will see God’s account how things will really be…… and most importantly, WHY they shall be. Join us for a difficult bible passage made clear.
item.description: Summary: Hollywood has made scores of movies, making millions of dollars, regarding “Armageddon”; but in our study today we will see God’s account how things will really be…… and most importantly, WHY they shall be. Join us for a difficult bible passage made clear.

item.title: Revelation 19:11-16
item.itunes:subtitle: Jesus on the White Horse
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In our passage today Jesus is Coming back on a white horse and we are riding with Him! Are you ready? We will read that His name is called “The Word of God”, and in this passage He will open His life-changing Word to us, which is the Treasure of Heaven. Join Us!
item.description: Summary: In our passage today Jesus is Coming back on a white horse and we are riding with Him! Are you ready? We will read that His name is called “The Word of God”, and in this passage He will open His life-changing Word to us, which is the Treasure of Heaven. Join Us!

item.title: Revelation 19:1-10
item.itunes:subtitle: The Marraige Supper of the Lamb
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In our passage today the glorious “Marriage Supper of the Lamb”, where we celebrate being the Bride of Christ, chosen and beloved and cherished and never will we part.  And, at the same time we get to be guests and celebrate each other's call of being chosen as the Bride of Christ; only in God's economy could that happen and it is a beautiful celebration and we don’t have to wait until we're there to celebrate, for it is already done because of what Christ has done for us on the Cross. So join us as we celebrate a wonderful passage.

item.title: Revelation 18:1-24
item.itunes:subtitle: The Destruction of Babylon & the World’s Economic Center
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In 1 hour, the world’s economic system that man had placed all their trust in will be destroyed. Although the last days is when this happens, God gives us a clear calling today of what and where to place our treasures. Join us for a fascinating chapter of the Bible.
item.description: Summary: In 1 hour, the world’s economic system that man had placed all their trust in will be destroyed. Although the last days is when this happens, God gives us a clear calling today of what and where to place our treasures. Join us for a fascinating chapter of the Bible.

item.title: Revelation 17:1-18
item.itunes:subtitle: The One World Religion
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In the last days, as seen in the Book of Revelation, there will be a unified one world religion. The Last Days world will not be without religion, but without Christ. We see the shades of the attempt of that today before our eyes. Join this study and see how this one-world religion will grow and come together in the Last Days, and then how it will be brought down in a moment by our Lord Jesus Christ.

Join this study and see how this one-world religion will grow and come together in the Last Days, and then how it will be brought down in a moment by our Lord Jesus Christ.

item.title: Revelation 16:1-21
item.itunes:subtitle: The 7 Bowls of God's Wrath
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: We are now coming to the sweeping final climax of the Tribulation Period as these bowls are poured out. Yet in every bowl then, God has a message for His church today, that can bring us into a place of victorious Christian living.
item.description: Summary: We are now coming to the sweeping final climax of the Tribulation Period as these bowls are poured out. Yet in every bowl then, God has a message for His church today, that can bring us into a place of victorious Christian living.

item.title: Revelation 15:1-8
item.itunes:subtitle: The Holiness of God
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Chapter 15 tells us what is going on in heaven, while all that is going on here on earth during the Tribulation Period. This chapter also clearly declares “why” there is a Tribulation Period.
item.description: Summary: Chapter 15 tells us what is going on in heaven, while all that is going on here on earth during the Tribulation Period. This chapter also clearly declares “why” there is a Tribulation Period.

item.title: Revelation 14:1-20
item.itunes:subtitle: Grace Still Abounds
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Even in the Tribulation Period, God still offers grace to a lost and dying world; so much so that it is shouted from heaven by an angel to every person on earth… the EVERLASTING GOSPEL. We will also study the great witness of the 144,00 that are sealed and kept of God, and how we too can have a great witness for God right now in our lives as well.

We will also study the great witness of the 144,00 that are sealed and kept of God, and how we too can have a great witness for God right now in our lives as well.

item.title: Revelation 13:11-18
item.itunes:subtitle: The False Prophet
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: The Antichrist (our last study), gets the front and center attention; but what is often missed is the power of this man “The False Prophet”. He will be a charismatic “religious” leader, who will lead the way for the rise and power and worship of the Antichrist. In our study today we will look at “5 Powers” associated with him, and what they mean to our walk with the Lord today.

item.title: Revelation 13:1-10
item.itunes:subtitle: The Antichrist (The Beast from the Sea)
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: The Bible predicts that a political, charismatic world leader will come onto the world scene known in Scripture as “The Antichrist” (1 John), or “The Beast” (Rev), or “The Man of Sin” (2 Thess. 2).  He will unite the world under his influential leadership with a temporary peace plan, only to break it and demand that everyone worship him as God  In our study today we will look at “5 Powers” associated with him, and what they mean to our walk with the Lord today.

item.title: Revelation 12:7-17
item.itunes:subtitle: The War in Heaven (part 2)
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: You and I are in a war whether we want to be or not and we need to accept and realize that, embrace it and lean into it, because the war is over you the war is over me and the war was over that person to your left and to your right who drove with you to church today who lives in the house with you friends, family, and relationships that is what the war is over. Now we have to ask ourselves what is worth fighting for, we have to ask ourselves are they worth fighting for because we're in this fight regardless how you feel about it. Although this is not a message on spiritual warfare as the classical approach often is we're going to study Revelation and we're going to see amazing details regarding the last days and why things are the way they are, and for the double blessing, we will see our adversary the devil and how to defeat him on this soil we live called earth.

item.title: Revelation 11:19
item.itunes:subtitle: The Ark of the Covenant
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In our passage God opens up and invites us into the Temple and Throne of God in heaven. In this invite God will show us the “Ark of the Covenant”. It is His “Covenant” with man, with you. What does His covenant say to us presently and yet future. What does the Ark of the Covenant speak to us about His mercy and grace? In our study we will let God “reveal” the depth of these things, and we will see His Glory from heaven unto us.

item.title: Revelation 11:15-19
item.itunes:subtitle: One Kingdom Under God
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary:
Summary: In our passage today, the kingdoms of this world have become the kingdom of our Lord; six thousand years in the making, will come to its full fruition. There cannot be the right kingdom until you have the right king, we will study King Jesus taking full possession of the earth. Then we will ask, has He

taken full possession of your heart?

item.title: Revelation 11:3-14
item.itunes:subtitle: The Two Witnesses of Revelation
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In our passage we will look at the Two Witnesses who preach for 3.5 years in Jerusalem. They will breath fire, shut the heavens from rain, and strike the earth with plagues. They will be killed, and all the earth will celebrate, but after 3.5 days God will raise them back to life, and call them Home. Who are they and why does it matter to us today, join us to find out.
item.description: Summary: In our passage we will look at the Two Witnesses who preach for 3.5 years in Jerusalem. They will breath fire, shut the heavens from rain, and strike the earth with plagues. They will be killed, and all the earth will celebrate, but after 3.5 days God will raise them back to life, and call them Home. Who are they and why does it matter to us today, join us to find out.

item.title: Revelation 11:1-2
item.itunes:subtitle: The Rebuilt Temple in Jerusalem
item.itunes:summary: Summary: This passage tells us the Temple will be rebuilt in Jerusalem. That sounds impossible considering all the wars and unrest in Israel today. However, Israel is the only Nation to survive 2,000 years without a homeland; that is miraculous! So if the Scriptures says the Temple will be rebuilt, it will. We will study why it needs to be rebuilt, and how the Temple of God relates to us personally today.

item.title: Revelation 10:1-11
item.itunes:subtitle: The Mighty Angel and the Little Book
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: The Apostle John in this chapter is told to keep prophesying, and he does until he finishes telling the world what God has said in all 22 chapters. He is given a book to eat, which was sweet to his mouth but bitter to his stomach. Our chapter before us today is the same calling, to keep telling all Jesus is coming, and the same bitter and sweetness when some receive and some reject the Word we share.

item.title: Revelation 9:1-21
item.itunes:subtitle: Yet They Still Would Not Repent
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary:
Summary: Man will say if God would only give me a sign I would follow Him, yet in the passage we will see that even a sign won’t change a person’s heart. Some will say they have this reason or that reason

for not following God, but we will see why a man or woman truly refuses to follow God. A powerful passage for the seeker, the skeptic, and the believer.
item.description:
Summary: Man will say if God would only give me a sign I would follow Him, yet in the passage we will see that even a sign won’t change a person’s heart. Some will say they have this reason or that reason

for not following God, but we will see why a man or woman truly refuses to follow God. A powerful passage for the seeker, the skeptic, and the believer.

item.title: Revelation 5 and Ruth 4
item.itunes:subtitle: Special Easter Message
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: We all have experienced the empty promises of the world and others. God gives us a beautiful “Empty Promise”, and that is an empty cross and an empty grave, with the Promise to us….. Paid in Ful! We all have a debt we owe for our sin, and it is a debt we cannot pay…. But God paid off our debt upon the cross. Join us for a special Easter Message.

item.title: Revelation 8:1-13
item.itunes:subtitle: Silence in Heaven & the 7 Trumpets of God
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: As we open this chapter, we read there will be 30 minutes of silence in heaven. All of heaven goes silent, because of what is next to come …. the 7 Trumpets. Yet even with the blast of each trumpet, we see God extending grace to mankind, to receive His offer of love and forgiveness of sin. The offer is for anyone today as well….. will you receive it?

item.title: Revelation 7:1-17
item.itunes:subtitle: The Sealed and The Saved
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Many believers do not want to study Revelation because they say the things written are too frightening, too depressing…. What? Today’s passage, brings great joy in that we see the great promise…… nobody can snatch us out of His hand, as we look at the 144,000 sealed of Israel, and the who knows how many millions upon millions (maybe even billions) who will be saved in the Tribulation Period.

item.title: Revelation 6:9-17
item.itunes:subtitle: You've Been Left Behind
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: There are those who know the truth, the need for the Savior for the forgiveness of sin, but chose not to receive Him today; as we continue with seals 5 and 6, we will see “today” is the day of salvation, for tomorrow may be too late.

item.title: Revelation 6:1-8
item.itunes:subtitle: The 4 Horseman of Revelation
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Although often quoted, generally known about, if we were to ask…. Who are they and why are they, most would not really know Today we will look at these four figures of Revelation, and what they are and why there are. Come Join Us!
item.description: Summary: Although often quoted, generally known about, if we were to ask…. Who are they and why are they, most would not really know Today we will look at these four figures of Revelation, and what they are and why there are. Come Join Us!

item.title: Revelation 5:8-14
item.itunes:subtitle: The Ultimate Worship Service
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: After all this world, the struggles, the warfare, the faithfulness, and endurance….. there will come a day that we will all be standing together, worshipping the Lord, in perfect unity, and perfect rest, no more pain, no more sorrow, for the former things will have passed away. What will that day be like? We read in our passage before us. But….. much to glean from on how we can bring a glimpse of heaven to earth. Join us!

item.title: Revelation 5:1-7
item.itunes:subtitle: The Lion, The Lamb, and the Scroll
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary:
Summary: Revelation chapter 5 is foundational for the understanding of why things are the way they are

on this earth. Why is there is evil? Why do bad things happen? Will it always be this way? Why does God

allow it? Chapter 5 “reveals” the answers to these things. Join us as we study this passage, verse-by-

verse.

item.title: Revelation 4:8-11
item.itunes:subtitle: Casting Crowns
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: When we get to the “Throne of Grace’, we will be casting our crowns at His feet. What are these crowns? How do we receive them? Why do we cast them? And the biggest question for us today is….. will I have any to cast? Join us, as we study how we “receive” these crowns.

item.itunes:subtitle: The Throne of God
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary:
Summary: In our passage today, we get a glimpse into the Throne of God. What a sight, and what an

invitation to “come and see”. This is a personal invitation from God Himself to you and me!

item.title: Revelation 3:14-22
item.itunes:subtitle: Lukewarm
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary:
Summary: Maybe you were once on-fire for the Lord, refreshing to His heart, but today find yourself like

the church of Laodicea….. lukewarm. How do you get back, maybe even how do you get started? Jesus

gives us four things in our passage today we can do, to change our spiritual temperature

item.title: Revelation 3:10-13
item.itunes:subtitle: What is the Rapture and Why Should I Care?
item.itunes:summary: Summary: In our study we will explore “Who is in the Rapture”. “What is the Rapture”, “When is the Rapture”, “Where is the Rapture”, “Why is there a Rapture”, and “How should we respond to the Rapture”.
item.description: Summary: In our study we will explore “Who is in the Rapture”. “What is the Rapture”, “When is the Rapture”, “Where is the Rapture”, “Why is there a Rapture”, and “How should we respond to the Rapture”.

item.title: Revelation 3:8-10
item.itunes:subtitle: What God Can Do with Our Little Strength
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: The Church of Philadelphia is the model Church, along with Smyrna it receives praises and promises from the Lord; God says they have “a little strength”, not great and mighty strength. Our worldsays we have to have great strength to do great things. Today we will be blessed to see, and relieved as well, how God does great things through our little strength. Be Encouraged.

item.title: Revelation 3:7-8
item.itunes:subtitle: Jesus - The Peg You can Hold On To
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: The Church of Philadelphia, is the model church of the seven churches in Revelation. We have lots to glean from the study of it, and today we start with “The Peg”, Jesus Himself that we can hang everything and all things off of in our lives (relationships, ministry, missions, and salvation).

item.itunes:subtitle: What in the World is Going On
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Looking at the News and Prophecy and seeing that things are not falling apart, but falling right in place as the scriptures said they would.

item.itunes:subtitle: He has a Door for You

item.title: Revelation 2:18-29
item.itunes:subtitle: Church of Thyatira
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Known as the “corrupt church”, as they did not just tolerate sin, they fully embraced it. Thyatira means “continual sacrifice”, and God gives the unveiling on how they, and us, can live the God-Life, a life that is a sweet fragrance to the Lord, and the world.

item.title: Revelation 2:8-11
item.itunes:subtitle: The Church of Smyrna (the Persecuted Church)
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary:
Summary: The Church of Smyrna is known for being the persecuted church, a church suffering

tribulation, but….. that remained faithful to the end. There is a power in a believer’s life that is unstoppable, cannot be overcome, that says…… even in the storm, I will still praise You Lord.
item.description:
Summary: The Church of Smyrna is known for being the persecuted church, a church suffering

tribulation, but….. that remained faithful to the end. There is a power in a believer’s life that is unstoppable, cannot be overcome, that says…… even in the storm, I will still praise You Lord.

item.title: Revelation 2:1-7
item.itunes:subtitle: The Church of Ephesus - Who Left Their First Love
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: The Church of Ephesus will go down in history as being known as the church (and individuals) that left their first love. Could that be us, could that be you today? Here is the vital point! They did not know it or notice it, even in the midst of all their good works and activities, the Lord had to speak to them to expose it. We would all do well, to hear this Word from the Lord today, and see if we could be in the same state and not know it.

item.title: Revelation 1:19
item.itunes:subtitle: Unlocking the Book of Revelation
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: God gives a divine outline for this book in our passage today, because He wants to “Reveal It – Unveil It”, it is anything but hidden. Once we see the 3 points of the outline, the Book becomes very easy to follow and unlock. Join us for the overview of Revelation, in one study!

item.title: Revelation 1:13-20
item.itunes:subtitle: The Glorified Christ
item.itunes:summary: Summary: The only physical description of Jesus in the New Testament is found in our verses today. For us all, see “The Glorified Christ”, and our vision will be clear on all things and everything.
item.description: Summary: The only physical description of Jesus in the New Testament is found in our verses today. For us all, see “The Glorified Christ”, and our vision will be clear on all things and everything.

item.title: Revelation 1:9-12
item.itunes:subtitle: Turn and See
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: Today passage John will hear the voice of God, and then “turned to see” the wonderful revelation of Jesus Christ. The Shepherds in Bethlehem “turned to see”, the Wise Men from the East “turned to see”, and Moses in the wilderness “turned to see”; and to all that did, they were gifted a deeper revelation of God. Today’s study, we get to “turn and see”.

item.title: Revelation 1:5-8
item.itunes:subtitle: Words for Comfort, to Consider, and to Count On (part 2)
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: This week we finish, what we began studying last week that the tendency when studying the Book of Revelation is to get to the what “John saw” regarding the unveiling of the Last Days, and they are very troubling sights indeed, So before God unfolds the book before us He brings words of comfort to His children so that they may fear not, and trust His sovereignty, and His Love.

item.title: Revelation 1:1-3
item.itunes:subtitle: Why Study the Book of Revelation
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: The word revelation means to unveil, to make known, yet many people can think this book is hard to understand; on the contrary, the Lord’s whole purpose is for us to understand it (reveal it to us). So much so God promises us a blessing (1:3) if we read it. The Book of Revelation is the only book in the Bible that comes with such a promise. Join us as we get blessed and begin this verse-by-verse study through the Book of Revelation.

item.title: Jude 1:1-7 (Defending the Faith)
item.itunes:subtitle: Jude 1:1-7
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary:
Passage: Jude 1:1-7


Title: Contending (Protecting and Defending) the Faith


Summary: For 2,000 years since Christ, there have been faithful saints who have contended (protected and defended) The Faith. They preserved “The Faith” for us, and now we have the same calling to protect and defend The Faith for the current and next generation. Jude gives us a great reminder of this calling.

item.title: No Greater Joy (Children Walking in Love & Truth)
item.itunes:subtitle: 3 John 1:1-14
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary: Summary: The Apostle John speaks the joy of every parent, and that is seeing their children walking in the love and truth of the Lord. While this is true for every parent, it is also an expression of the joy our Heavenly Father has when we His children do the same. In our passage, the Lord will declare 5 things that when we do them brings Him joy. Join us as we look into the Heart of the Father.

item.title: 2 John 1:1-13
item.itunes:author: Pastor Ray Bollas
item.itunes:summary:
Passage: 2 John 1-13


Title: The Guardians of the Gospel (Truth & Love)


Summary: We often say “Truth and Love” need to be balanced, but for us it is when we combine them and weave them together as inseparable, that we find great and tremendous power in our walk with the Lord, and with all our personal relationships (marriage, family, friendships, and neighbors).
